MILAN REVEAL KEEPER OFFER

AC Milan sporting director Massimiliano Mirabelli says the club was willing to offer 18-year-old goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma a £44m deal, but he has decided not to sign.

He told “Corriere dello Sport: "He would have had the captain’s armband and, frankly, it was an enormous offer, considering his young age and Milan’s situation: €25million (£22m) net over five years means €50million (£44m) gross for the club."

MILAN REVEAL KEEPER OFFER

AC Milan sporting director Massimiliano Mirabelli says the club was willing to offer 18-year-old goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma a £44m deal, but he has decided not to sign.

He told “Corriere dello Sport: "He would have had the captain’s armband and, frankly, it was an enormous offer, considering his young age and Milan’s situation: €25million (£22m) net over five years means €50million (£44m) gross for the club."

PSV STAR WANTS TO JOIN MAN UTD

PSV striker Jurgen Locadia says he dreams of playing for Manchester United.

He told Dutch TV channel NOS. “Manchester United is my dream, but via an intermediate step. I like the path Georginio Wijnaldum has walked, from Newcastle United to Liverpool.”
Chelsea are looking to bring in another goalkeeper to play back-up to Thibaut Courtois and their target, Willy Caballero, is apparently wanted by several clubs, according to his agent.
